title: Quantitative or Qualitative
text: We want to determine the weights of sumo wrestlers. We know that qualitative data focuses on categorization while quantiative data focuses on numerical analysis. We can determine if this is qualitative or quantitative since qualitative data usually uses data while quantitative involves counting or measuring numerical values.

title: Quantitative or Qualitative
text: Is the weights of sumo wrestlers qualitative or quantitative data?

title: Continuous or Discrete
text: Now, we know that weight is a quantitative value. To decide whether it is discrete or continuous, we must decide if we can have $$\frac{fractions}{decimals}$$ of a weight. For instance, is it valid to have a weight of $$100$$ pounds? How about $$100.2$$ pounds? If it is valid to include fractions or decimals of a $$\frac{pound}{any}$$ unit of weight, choose continuous, otherwise, choose discrete.
